      • usageCategorizer

        public ArrayList<LinkedHashMap<String,Integer>> usageCategorizer(List<App> appList,
                                                                 int numOfDays)
        This method takes in List of App and categorise them into different usage intensities
        Parameters:
        numOfDays - Number of days in the period
        appList - List of App
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of LinkedHashMap with macAddresses as the unique key and the average time for respective user

      • countUniqueUsers

        public int countUniqueUsers(List<App> appList)
        This method takes in BasicAppUsage and List of App It calculates the number of unique users in the appList provided
        Parameters:
        appList - List of App
        Returns:
        the number of unique users

      • sortByCCA

        public void sortByCCA(BasicAppUsage basicAppUsage,
                      List<App> appList,
                      int curLevel,
                      int maxLevel,
                      int numOfDays)
        This method sorts the appList into the various CCAs and create a respective sub-category within the BasicAppUsage object.
        Parameters:
        basicAppUsage - BasicAppUsage object
        appList - List of App
        curLevel - Current level of categorisation
        maxLevel - Maximum level of categorisation
        numOfDays - Number of Days based on start date and end date

        curLevel - Current level of categorisation
        maxLevel - Maximum level of categorisation

      • retrieveAppUsageByDemographicBreakdown

        public BasicAppUsage retrieveAppUsageByDemographicBreakdown(String startDate,
                                                            String endDate,
                                                            String categories)
        This method returns an output of BasicAppUsage given the order of which it is to be broken down into.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Input start date in the format of yyyy/mm/dd
        endDate - Input end date in the format of yyyy/mm/dd
        categories - Input categories as Gender, Year, School or CCA
        Returns:
        a BasicAppUsage object

      • retrieveAppByStartEndDate

        public HashMap<String,Integer> retrieveAppByStartEndDate(String startDate,
                                                         String endDate)
        This method returns a HashMap of mac addresses and their respective app usage time
        Parameters:
        startDate - Input start date in the format of yyyy/mm/dd
        endDate - Input end date in the format of yyyy/mm/dd
        Returns:
        HashMap with mac addresses as the unique key and app usage time as the respective value

      • retrieveUsageCategory

        public HashMap<String,Integer> retrieveUsageCategory(HashMap<String,Integer> usageTimeByStartDate)
        This method returns a HashMap of usage intensities and the count of users that fall into that category.
        Parameters:
        usageTimeByStartDate - HashMap of macAddress as the unique key and usage time as the respective value
        Returns:
        HashMap with usage intensities (intense, normal or mild) as the key and the count of users as the respective value

      • diurnalUsageFilter

        public List<App> diurnalUsageFilter(List<App> appList,
                                    String gender,
                                    String school,
                                    String year)
        This method returns a filtered list of apps given the respective filter conditions e.g gender: "M", school: "SIS", year:"2015"
        Parameters:
        appList - List of App that is not filtered
        gender - Gender input field as male (M) or female (F)
        school - School input field as sis, law, business, socsc, economics, accountancy
        year - Year input field as 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014 or 2015
        Returns:
        list of App that matches the selected gender, school or year

      • getBasicAppDiurnalUsage

        public LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> getBasicAppDiurnalUsage(String date,
                                                             String gender,
                                                             String school,
                                                             String year)
        This method returns a LinkedHashMap of hourly durations and its respective average usage in that hour.
        Parameters:
        date - Date input field in the format yyyy/mm/dd
        gender - Gender input field as male (M) or female (F)
        school - School input field as sis, law, business, socsc, economics, accountancy
        year - Year input field as 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014 or 2015
        Returns:
        LinkedHashMap with the hourly period time as the unique key and average usage time as the respective value

      • calculateAppUsageTime

        public int calculateAppUsageTime(App app1,
                                 App app2)
        This method will take the difference between two app usage time and return the calculation of the difference while checking if the two app usage belongs to the same user (i.e. same macaddress) and verify if they are recorded within the same day E.g Duration in seconds for app_1 = calculateAppUsageTime(app_1, app_2) where app_2 is the next app usage.
        Parameters:
        app1 - First App input
        app2 - Second App input
        Returns:
        calculated time difference between the two app

      • retrieveAppUsageByCategory

        public LinkedHashMap<String,Double> retrieveAppUsageByCategory(String startDate,
                                                               String endDate)
        This method returns a LinkedHashMap of average usage time for each app category.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Input start date in the format of yyyy/mm/dd
        endDate - Input end date in the format of yyyy/mm/dd
        Returns:
        LinkedHashmap with app categories as the unique key and the average usage time as the respective value
